definitions.definition: To give money or other compensation to in exchange for goods or services.
definitions.example: he paid her off the books and in kind where possible

definitions.definition: To discharge, as a debt or other obligation, by giving or doing what is due or required.
definitions.example: he has paid his debt to society
It didn't pay him to keep the store open any more.

definitions.definition: To be profitable or worth the effort.
To discharge an obligation or debt.
definitions.example: He was allowed to go as soon as he paid.
He paid for his fun in the sun with a terrible sunburn.

definitions.definition: To admit that a joke, punchline, etc., was funny.
To cover (the bottom of a vessel, a seam, a spar, etc.) with tar or pitch, or a waterproof composition of tallow, resin, etc.; to smear.
